packages.name: A3
packages.description: This package supplies tools for tabulating and analyzing the results of predictive models. The methods employed are applicable to virtually any predictive model and make comparisons between different methodologies straightforward.
packages.author: Scott Fortmann-Roe
packages.title: A3: Accurate, Adaptable, and Accessible Error Metrics for Predictive Models

packages.name: A3
packages.description: This package supplies tools for tabulating and analyzing the results of predictive models. The methods employed are applicable to virtually any predictive model and make comparisons between different methodologies straightforward.
packages.author: Scott Fortmann-Roe
packages.title: A3: Accurate, Adaptable, and Accessible Error Metrics for Predictive Models

packages.name: AnaCoDa
packages.description: Is a collection of models to analyze genome scale codon data using a Bayesian framework. Provides visualization routines and checkpointing for model fittings. Currently published models to analyze gene data for selection on codon
packages.author: Cedric Landerer [aut, cre], Gabriel Hanas [ctb], Jeremy Rogers [ctb], Alex Cope [ctb], Denizhan Pak [ctb]
packages.suggests: knitr, Hmisc, VGAM, coda, testthat, lmodel2
packages.title: Analysis of Codon Data under Stationarity using a Bayesian Framework

packages.name: Benchmarking
packages.description: Estimates and graphs deterministic (DEA) frontier models with different technology assumptions (fdh, vrs, drs, crs, irs, add). Also handles possible slacks, peers and their weights (lambdas), optimal cost, revenue and profit allocation, super--efficiency, and mergers. A comparative method for estimating SFA efficiencies is included.
packages.author: Peter Bogetoft and Lars Otto
packages.title: Benchmark and frontier analysis using DEA and SFA

packages.name: abc
packages.description: The package implements several ABC algorithms for performing parameter estimation and model selection. Cross-validation tools are also available for measuring the accuracy of ABC estimates, and to calculate the misclassification probabilities of different models.
packages.author: Katalin Csillery, Michael Blum and Olivier Francois
packages.title: Tools for Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC)

packages.name: accrued
packages.description: Package for visualizing data quality of partially accruing time series.
packages.author: Julie Eaton and Ian Painter
packages.title: Visualization tools for partially accruing data

packages.name: bea.R
packages.description: Provides an R interface for the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA)
packages.author: Andrea Batch [aut, cre], Jeff Chen [ctb], Walt Kampas [ctb]
packages.imports: httr, DT, shiny, jsonlite, googleVis, shinydashboard, ggplot2, stringr, chron, gtable, scales, htmltools, httpuv, xtable, stringi, magrittr, htmlwidgets, Rcpp, munsell, colorspace, plyr, yaml
packages.title: Bureau of Economic Analysis API

packages.name: npordtests
packages.description: Performs nonparametric tests for equality of location against ordered alternatives.
packages.author: Bulent Altunkaynak [aut, cre], Hamza Gamgam [aut]
packages.title: Nonparametric Tests for Equality of Location Against Ordered Alternatives

packages.name: usl
packages.description: The Universal Scalability Law (Gunther 2007)
packages.author: Neil J. Gunther [aut], Stefan Moeding [aut, cre]
packages.title: Analyze System Scalability with the Universal Scalability Law

packages.name: visdat
packages.description: Create preliminary exploratory data visualisations of an entire dataset to identify problems or unexpected features using 'ggplot2'.
packages.author: Nicholas Tierney [aut, cre]
packages.imports: ggplot2, tidyr, dplyr, purrr, magrittr, stats
packages.title: Preliminary Data Visualisation
